title: Convoy C: Rates, Income, and Demand Modeling
description: Research rates (per word/hour/project), throughput, income scenarios (conservative/moderate/optimistic), seasonal variability, client acquisition realities, burnout risks. Include clear math and sensitivity analysis.

title: Income Modeling: Industry Rates
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research industry-standard proofreading rates: per word, per hour, per project. Document rate variations by client type (publisher vs indie). Include reputable rate survey data.

title: Income Modeling: Throughput and Scenarios
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Model realistic throughput (words per hour/day/week). Create income scenarios: conservative, moderate, optimistic. Include seasonal variability, client acquisition realities, burnout risks. Clear math with sensitivity analysis.

title: pr-3cf.2 COMPLETED
description:
Task pr-3cf.2 (Income Modeling: Throughput and Scenarios) is complete.

Created: research/03-income-modeling.md

Summary:
- Throughput analysis: 2,000-2,500 words/hour sustainable for clean fiction
- Three income scenarios modeled over 3 years
- Sensitivity analysis on rates, throughput, and capacity utilization
- Real-world constraints: seasonal variability, burnout limits, client acquisition challenges
- Key finding: Starting rates produce $10/hour effective. Market rates ($0.02+) required for viability
- 3-year minimum timeline to full-time income

title: Convoy D: Long-Term AP Career Reality
description: Analyze 10-30 year AP career outlook, ceiling/floor, manager vs IC tracks, stress patterns, aging in role, maintaining employability, risks and mitigations.

title: Long-Term AP Career: 10-30 Year Outlook
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Analyze what a 10-30 year career in AP realistically looks like. Document ceiling/floor of responsibility, managerial vs IC tracks, stress patterns across calendar year. Include aging in role (physical, cognitive, organizational tolerance) and how to maintain employability.

title: Long-Term AP Risks & Mitigations
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Document long-term AP career risks: monotony, organizational neglect, automation creep. Research mitigations: specialization, process ownership, cross-training within AP. Focus on strategies for remaining in AP specifically, not transitioning out.

title: Convoy A: Proofreading Market Research

title: Market Research: Define Proofreading
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research and document: What proofreading actually is (and is not). Difference between proofreading, copyediting, line editing, developmental editing. Where proofreading sits in publishing pipeline. Use professional associations and publishing industry sources.

title: Market Research: Who Hires Proofreaders
description: Research who hires proofreaders: traditional publishers, small presses, self-publishing authors, academic/nonfiction publishers. Document hiring patterns, volume, and requirements for each segment.

title: Market Research: Demand and Competition Analysis
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research current market demand signals, market saturation, competition realities. Document common misconceptions about proofreading as a career. Include typical working conditions and expectations.

title: Convoy A: AP Industry & Role Research
description: Research what AP does in enterprises, department structures, job titles, responsibilities by level, company size differences, daily realities, frustrations, why people stay/leave.

title: AP Role Research: What AP Does & Department Structure
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research what Accounts Payable actually does in modern enterprises. Document AP department structures, job titles (Clerk, Specialist, Senior, Lead, Supervisor, Manager), and core responsibilities by level. Include how AP interacts with Purchasing, Receiving, Finance, Treasury.

title: AP Role Research: Daily Reality & Company Size Differences
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research daily realities of AP work: volume, repetition, deadlines, interruptions. Document differences between small company AP, mid-market AP, and enterprise AP. Include common frustrations, failure modes, why people stay in AP long-term, why people leave.

title: Convoy B: AP Skills, Training & Entry
description: Research core skills, tools (ERPs, Excel), education requirements, certifications, how to get first AP job, transition paths, time-to-competence.

title: AP Training: Skills, Tools & Certifications
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research core skills for entry-level AP. Document what differentiates strong vs weak AP employees. Cover tools: ERPs (SAP, Oracle, NetSuite, Dynamics), Excel, invoice management systems. Include education requirements (actual vs nice-to-have), certifications (AIP, bookkeeping certs).

title: AP Entry: How to Get First Job & Transition Paths
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research how people realistically get their first AP job. Document transition paths from adjacent roles (admin, clerk, accounting). Include on-the-job learning expectations and time-to-competence estimates.

title: Convoy D: Fiction vs Non-Fiction Specialization
description: Analyze differences in workflow/skills/mindset, clients, rates, risk profiles, viability for solo practitioner, early vs late specialization.

title: Fiction vs Non-Fiction Analysis
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Analyze differences in workflow, skills, mindset between fiction and non-fiction proofreading. Document typical clients, hiring patterns, rate differences, risk profiles. Assess viability for solo practitioner. Evaluate early vs late specialization strategy.

title: Convoy B: Skills, Training, and Pathways
description: Research core skills, credentials, training pathways, portfolio-building, timelines to competence, getting first clients, fiction vs non-fiction expectations. Output: path_to_book_proofreader.pdf

title: Skills Research: Core Competencies
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research and define required core skills for professional proofreading. Document optional but valuable credentials and certifications. Include realistic assessments of skill gaps for beginners.

title: Training Pathways Analysis
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research training pathways: self-study options, formal courses, mentoring opportunities. Evaluate quality and ROI of each. Document realistic timelines to competence. Include how proofreaders get first book clients.
